content: Calculate the total volume of a rectangular prism with length, width, and height of 14 meters, 4 meters, and 8 meters respectively.

To calculate the total volume of a rectangular prism, you can use the formula:

\[ \text{Volume} = \text{Length} \times \text{Width} \times \text{Height} \]

Given the dimensions:
- Length = 14 meters
- Width = 4 meters
- Height = 8 meters

Plug these values into the formula:

\[ \text{Volume} = 14 \, \text{m} \times 4 \, \text{m} \times 8 \, \text{m} \]

\[ \text{Volume} = 448 \, \text{cubic meters} \]

So, the total volume of the rectangular prism is 448 cubic meters.
